Structs/Atmosphere.html#/color.name: color
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/color.abstract: The color of the atmosphere region immediately below the horizon and within the range and above the horizon and within horizon-blend. Using opacity is recommended only for smoothly transitioning fog on/off as anything less than 100% opacity results in more tiles loaded and drawn.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/highColor.name: highColor
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/highColor.abstract: The color of the atmosphere region above the horizon, high-color extends further above the horizon than the color property and its spread can be controlled with horizon-blend. The opacity can be set to 0 to remove the high atmosphere color contribution.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/horizonBlend.name: horizonBlend
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/horizonBlend.abstract: Horizon blend applies a smooth fade from the color of the atmosphere to the color of space. A value of zero leaves a sharp transition from atmosphere to space. Increasing the value blends the color of atmosphere into increasingly high angles of the sky.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/range.name: range
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/range.abstract: The start and end distance range in which fog fades from fully transparent to fully opaque. The distance to the point at the center of the map is defined as zero, so that negative range values are closer to the camera, and positive values are farther away.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/spaceColor.name: spaceColor
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/spaceColor.abstract: The color of the region above the horizon and after the end of the horizon-blend contribution. The opacity can be set to 0 to have a transparent background.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/starIntensity.name: starIntensity
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/starIntensity.abstract: A value controlling the star intensity where 0 will show no stars and 1 will show stars at their maximum intensity.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineRoundLimit
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineDasharray
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with lineMetrics: true specified won’t render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineTranslate
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineTrimOffset
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: The line part between [trim-start, trim-end] will be marked as transparent to make a route vanishing effect. The line trim-off offset is based on the whole line range [0.0, 1.0].

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineSor.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineBlu.name: lineBlur
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineBlu.abstract: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineCol.name: lineColor
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineCol.abstract: The color with which the line will be drawn.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineGap.name: lineGapWidth
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineGap.abstract: Draws a line casing outside of a line’s actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineOff.name: lineOffset
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineOff.abstract: The line’s offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineOpa.name: lineOpacity
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/lineOpa.abstract: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/linePat.name: linePattern
Structs/PolylineAnnotation.html#/linePat.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html#/f.abstract: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html#/f.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/isDragga.abstract: Property to determine whether annotation can be manually moved around map

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/init(id:.abstract: Create a polygon annotation with a Polygon and an optional identifier.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillSort.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillColo.name: fillColor
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillColo.abstract: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as rgba with an alpha component and the color’s opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillOpac.name: fillOpacity
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillOpac.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the fill-color, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillOutl.name: fillOutlineColor
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillOutl.abstract: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of fill-color if unspecified.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillPatt.name: fillPattern
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/fillPatt.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/del.name: delegate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/del.abstract: Set this delegate in order to be called back if a tap occurs on an annotation being managed by this manager.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/syn.name: syncSourceAndLayerIfNeeded()
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/syn.abstract: Synchronizes the backing source and layer with the current annotations

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconAllowOverlap
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconIgnorePlacement
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconKeepUpright
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconOptional
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconPitchAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconRotationAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconTextFit
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconTextFitPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by icon-text-fit, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/sym.name: symbolAvoidEdges
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/sym.abstract: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/sym.name: symbolZOrder
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/sym.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textAllowOverlap
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textFont
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: Font stack to use for displaying text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textIgnorePlacement
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textKeepUpright
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textOptional
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textPitchAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textRotationAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textVariableAnchor
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of text-anchor locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use text-justify: auto to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the text-radial-offset or the two-dimensional text-offset.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textWritingMode
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.name: iconTranslate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/ico.abstract: Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.name: textTranslate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/tex.abstract: Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/isDraggabl.name: isDraggable
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/isDraggabl.abstract: Property to determine whether annotation can be manually moved around map

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/init(id:po.name: init(id:point:)
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/init(id:po.abstract: Create a point annotation with a Point and an optional identifier.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/init(id:co.name: init(id:coordinate:)
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/init(id:co.abstract: Create a point annotation with a coordinate and an optional identifier

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconAnchor.name: iconAnchor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconAnchor.abstract: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconImage.name: iconImage
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconImage.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconOffset.name: iconOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconOffset.abstract: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of icon-size to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with icon-rotate the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconSize.name: iconSize
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconSize.abstract: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by icon-size. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/symbolSort.name: symbolSortKey
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/symbolSort.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is false, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is set to true, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textAnchor.name: textAnchor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textAnchor.abstract: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textField.name: textField
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textField.abstract: Value to use for a text label. If a plain string is provided, it will be treated as a formatted with default/inherited formatting options. SDF images are not supported in formatted text and will be ignored.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textMaxWid.name: textMaxWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textMaxWid.abstract: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textOffset.name: textOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textOffset.abstract: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textRadial.name: textRadialOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textRadial.abstract: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol’s anchor. Useful in combination with text-variable-anchor, which defaults to using the two-dimensional text-offset if present.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textTransf.name: textTransform
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textTransf.abstract: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS text-transform property.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconColor.name: iconColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconColor.abstract: The color of the icon. This can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloBl.name: iconHaloBlur
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloBl.abstract: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloCo.name: iconHaloColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloCo.abstract: The color of the icon’s halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloWi.name: iconHaloWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconHaloWi.abstract: Distance of halo to the icon outline.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconOpacit.name: iconOpacity
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/iconOpacit.abstract: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textColor.name: textColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textColor.abstract: The color with which the text will be drawn.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloBl.name: textHaloBlur
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloBl.abstract: The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloCo.name: textHaloColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloCo.abstract: The color of the text’s halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloWi.name: textHaloWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textHaloWi.abstract: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is ¼ of the font-size.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textOpacit.name: textOpacity
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/textOpacit.abstract: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/de.name: delegate
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/de.abstract: Set this delegate in order to be called back if a tap occurs on an annotation being managed by this manager.

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/sy.name: syncSourceAndLayerIfNeeded()
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/sy.abstract: Synchronizes the backing source and layer with the current annotations

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.name: circlePitchAlignment
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.name: circlePitchScale
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.name: circleTranslate
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html#/ci.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/isDraggab.name: isDraggable
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/isDraggab.abstract: Property to determine whether annotation can be manually moved around map

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/init(id:p.name: init(id:point:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/init(id:p.abstract: Create a circle annotation with a Point and an optional identifier.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/init(id:c.name: init(id:centerCoordinate:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/init(id:c.abstract: Create a circle annotation with a center coordinate and an optional identifier

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleSor.name: circleSortKey
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleSor.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleBlu.name: circleBlur
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleBlu.abstract: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleOpa.name: circleOpacity
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleOpa.abstract: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleStr.name: circleStrokeWidth
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/circleStr.abstract: The width of the circle’s stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the circle-radius.

Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/source.name: sourceId
Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/source.abstract: The id of the GeoJSONSource that this manager is responsible for.

Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/layerI.name: layerId
Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/layerI.abstract: The id of the layer that this manager is responsible for.

Protocols/Annotation.html#/geometry.name: geometry
Protocols/Annotation.html#/geometry.abstract: The geometry that is backing this annotation.

Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..name: annotationManager(_:didDetectTappedAnnotations:)
Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..abstract: This method is invoked when a tap gesture is detected on an annotation

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/ann.name: annotationManagersById
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/ann.abstract: Dictionary of annotation managers keyed by their identifiers.

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.name: makePointAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:clusterOptions:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.abstract: Creates a PointAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.name: makePolygonAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.abstract: Creates a PolygonAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.name: makePolylineAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.abstract: Creates a PolylineAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.name: makeCircleAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/mak.abstract: Creates a CircleAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/rem.name: removeAnnotationManager(withId:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/rem.abstract: Removes an annotation manager, this will remove the underlying layer and source from the style.

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html.name: AnnotationOrchestrator
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html.abstract: AnnotationOrchestrator provides a way to create annotation managers of different types.

Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..name: AnnotationInteractionDelegate
Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..abstract: A delegate that is called when a tap is detected on an annotation (or on several of them).

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html.name: CircleAnnotationManager
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of CircleAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of CircleAnnotations.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html.name: PointAnnotationManager
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PointAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PointAnnotations.

Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html.name: PolygonAnnotationManager
Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PolygonAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PolygonAnnotations.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html.name: PolylineAnnotationManager
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PolylineAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PolylineAnnotations.

Structs/ClusterOptions.html.name: ClusterOptions
Structs/ClusterOptions.html.abstract: Options to configure point annotation clustering with PointAnnotationManager.

Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/diacriticS.name: diacriticSensitive
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/diacriticS.abstract: Whether the comparison operation is diacritic sensitive

Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/locale.name: locale
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/locale.abstract: The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/locale.name: locale
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/locale.abstract: Specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/curren.name: currency
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/curren.abstract: Specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/minFra.name: minFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/minFra.abstract: Minimum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/maxFra.name: maxFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/maxFra.abstract: Maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/fontScale.name: fontScale
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/fontScale.abstract: Applies a scaling factor on text-size as specified by the root layout property.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/textFont.name: textFont
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/textFont.abstract: Overrides the font stack specified by the root layout property

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/textColor.name: textColor
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/textColor.abstract: Overrides the color specified by the root paint property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/subtra.name: subtract
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/subtra.abstract: For two inputs, returns the result of subtracting the second input from the first. For a single input, returns the result of subtracting it from 0.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/not.name: not
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/not.abstract: Logical negation. Returns true if the input is false, and false if the input is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/neq.name: neq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/neq.abstract: Returns true if the input values are not equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/divisi.name: division
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/divisi.abstract: Returns the result of floating point division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/mod.name: mod
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/mod.abstract: Returns the remainder after integer division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/pow.name: pow
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/pow.abstract: Returns the result of raising the first input to the power specified by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/lt.name: lt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/lt.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly less than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/lte.name: lte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/lte.abstract: Returns true if the first input is less than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/eq.name: eq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/eq.abstract: Returns true if the input values are equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/gt.name: gt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/gt.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly greater than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/gte.name: gte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/gte.abstract: Returns true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/abs.name: abs
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/abs.abstract: Returns the absolute value of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/accumu.name: accumulated
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/accumu.abstract: Returns the value of a cluster property accumulated so far. Can only be used in the clusterProperties option of a clustered GeoJSON source.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/all.name: all
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/all.abstract: Returns true if all the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to false, the result is false and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/any.name: any
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/any.abstract: Returns true if any of the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to true, the result is true and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/array.name: array
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/array.abstract: Asserts that the input is an array (optionally with a specific item type and length). If, when the input expression is evaluated, it is not of the asserted type, then this assertion will cause the whole expression to be aborted.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/boolea.name: boolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/boolea.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a boolean. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a boolean is obtained. If none of the inputs are booleans, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/switch.name: switchCase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/switch.abstract: Selects the first output whose corresponding test condition evaluates to true, or the fallback value otherwise.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/ceil.name: ceil
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/ceil.abstract: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/coales.name: coalesce
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/coales.abstract: Evaluates each expression in turn until the first valid value is obtained. Invalid values are null and 'image' expressions that are unavailable in the style. If all values are invalid, coalesce returns the first value listed.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/collat.name: collator
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/collat.abstract: Returns a collator for use in locale-dependent comparison operations. The case-sensitive and diacritic-sensitive options default to false. The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use. If none is provided, the default locale is used. If the requested locale is not available, the collator will use a system-defined fallback locale. Use resolved-locale to test the results of locale fallback behavior.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/concat.name: concat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/concat.abstract: Returns a string consisting of the concatenation of the inputs. Each input is converted to a string as if by to-string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/distan.name: distance
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/distan.abstract: Returns the shortest distance in meters between the evaluated feature and the input geometry. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, Feature, or FeatureCollection. Distance values returned may vary in precision due to loss in precision from encoding geometries, particularly below zoom level 13.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/distan.name: distanceFromCenter
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/distan.abstract: Returns the distance of a symbol instance from the center of the map. The distance is measured in pixels divided by the height of the map container. It measures 0 at the center, decreases towards the camera and increase away from the camera. For example, if the height of the map is 1000px, a value of -1 means 1000px away from the center towards the camera, and a value of 1 means a distance of 1000px away from the camera from the center. ["distance-from-center"] may only be used in the filter expression for a symbol layer.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/downca.name: downcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/downca.abstract: Returns the input string converted to lowercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/featur.name: featureState
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/featur.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s state. Returns null if the requested property is not present on the feature’s state. A feature’s state is not part of the GeoJSON or vector tile data, and must be set programmatically on each feature. Features are identified by their id attribute, which must be an integer or a string that can be cast to an integer. Note that [“feature-state”] can only be used with paint properties that support data-driven styling.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/floor.name: floor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/floor.abstract: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/format.name: format
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/format.abstract: Returns a formatted string for displaying mixed-format text in the text-field property. The input may contain a string literal or expression, including an 'image' expression. Strings may be followed by a style override object that supports the following properties:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/geomet.name: geometryType
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/geomet.abstract: Returns the feature’s geometry type: Point, LineString or Polygon. Multi* feature types return the singular forms.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/get.name: get
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/get.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided. Returns null if the requested property is missing.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/has.name: has
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/has.abstract: Tests for the presence of an property value in the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/heatma.name: heatmapDensity
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/heatma.abstract: Returns the kernel density estimation of a pixel in a heatmap layer, which is a relative measure of how many data points are crowded around a particular pixel. Can only be used in the heatmap-color property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/id.name: id
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/id.abstract: Returns the feature’s id, if it has one.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/image.name: image
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/image.abstract: Returns a ResolvedImage for use in icon-image, *-pattern entries, and as a section in the 'format' expression. A 'coalesce' expression containing image expressions will evaluate to the first listed image that is currently in the style. This validation process is synchronous and requires the image to have been added to the style before requesting it in the 'image' argument.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/inExpr.name: inExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/inExpr.abstract: Determines whether an item exists in an array or a substring exists in a string. In the specific case when the second and third arguments are string literals, you must wrap at least one of them in a literal expression to hint correct interpretation to the type system.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/indexO.name: indexOf
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/indexO.abstract: Returns the first position at which an item can be found in an array or a substring can be found in a string, or -1 if the input cannot be found. Accepts an optional index from where to begin the search.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/interp.name: interpolate
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/interp.abstract: Produces continuous, smooth results by interpolating between pairs of input and output values (“stops”). The input may be any numeric expression (e.g., ["get", "population"]). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. The output type must be number, array<number>, or color.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/isSupp.name: isSupportedScript
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/isSupp.abstract: Returns true if the input string is expected to render legibly. Returns false if the input string contains sections that cannot be rendered without potential loss of meaning (e.g. Indic scripts that require complex text shaping, or right-to-left scripts if the the mapbox-gl-rtl-text plugin is not in use in Mapbox GL JS).

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/length.name: length
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/length.abstract: Returns the length of an array or string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/letExp.name: letExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/letExp.abstract: Binds expressions to named variables, which can then be referenced in the result expression using [“var”, “variable_name”].

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/linePr.name: lineProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/linePr.abstract: Returns the progress along a gradient line. Can only be used in the line-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/litera.name: literal
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/litera.abstract: Provides a literal array or object value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/ln.name: ln
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/ln.abstract: Returns the natural logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/log10.name: log10
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/log10.abstract: Returns the base-ten logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/log2.name: log2
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/log2.abstract: Returns the base-two logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/match.name: match
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/match.abstract: Selects the output for which the label value matches the input value, or the fallback value if no match is found. The input can be any expression (for example, ["get", "building_type"]). Each label must be unique, and must be either:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/max.name: max
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/max.abstract: Returns the maximum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/min.name: min
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/min.abstract: Returns the minimum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/number.name: number
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/number.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a number. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a number is obtained. If none of the inputs are numbers, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/number.name: numberFormat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/number.abstract: Converts the input number into a string representation using the providing formatting rules. If set, the locale argument specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag. If set, the currency argument specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting. If set, the unit argument specifies a simple ECMAScript unit to use for unit-style formatting. If set, the min and max arguments specify the minimum and maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/object.name: objectExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/object.abstract: Asserts that the input value is an object. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until an object is obtained. If none of the inputs are objects, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/pitch.name: pitch
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/pitch.abstract: Returns the current pitch in degrees. ["pitch"] may only be used in the filter expression for a symbol layer.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/proper.name: properties
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/proper.abstract: Returns the feature properties object. Note that in some cases, it may be more efficient to use ["get", "property_name"] directly.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/resolv.name: resolvedLocale
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/resolv.abstract: Returns the IETF language tag of the locale being used by the provided collator. This can be used to determine the default system locale, or to determine if a requested locale was successfully loaded.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/rgb.name: rgb
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/rgb.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, and blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component of 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/rgba.name: rgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/rgba.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component which must range between 0 and 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/round.name: round
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/round.abstract: Rounds the input to the nearest integer. Halfway values are rounded away from zero. For example, ["round", -1.5] evaluates to -2.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/skyRad.name: skyRadialProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/skyRad.abstract: Returns the distance of a point on the sky from the sun position. Returns 0 at sun position and 1 when the distance reaches sky-gradient-radius. Can only be used in the sky-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/slice.name: slice
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/slice.abstract: Returns an item from an array or a substring from a string from a specified start index, or between a start index and an end index if set. The return value is inclusive of the start index but not of the end index.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/sqrt.name: sqrt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/sqrt.abstract: Returns the square root of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/step.name: step
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/step.abstract: Produces discrete, stepped results by evaluating a piecewise-constant function defined by pairs of input and output values (“stops”). The input may be any numeric expression (e.g., ["get", "population"]). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. Returns the output value of the stop just less than the input, or the first output if the input is less than the first stop.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/string.name: string
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/string.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a string. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a string is obtained. If none of the inputs are strings, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toBool.name: toBoolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toBool.abstract: Converts the input value to a boolean. The result is false when then input is an empty string, 0, false, null, or NaN; otherwise it is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toColo.name: toColor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toColo.abstract: Converts the input value to a color. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toNumb.name: toNumber
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toNumb.abstract: Converts the input value to a number, if possible. If the input is null or false, the result is 0. If the input is true, the result is 1. If the input is a string, it is converted to a number as specified by the “ToNumber Applied to the String Type” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toRgba.name: toRgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toRgba.abstract: Returns a four-element array containing the input color’s red, green, blue, and alpha components, in that order.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toStri.name: toString
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/toStri.abstract: Converts the input value to a string. If the input is null, the result is "". If the input is a boolean, the result is "true" or "false". If the input is a number, it is converted to a string as specified by the “NumberToString” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If the input is a color, it is converted to a string of the form "rgba(r,g,b,a)", where r, g, and b are numerals ranging from 0 to 255, and a ranges from 0 to 1. If the input is an 'image' expression, 'to-string' returns the image name. Otherwise, the input is converted to a string in the format specified by the JSON.stringify function of the ECMAScript Language Specification.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/typeof.name: typeofExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/typeof.abstract: Returns a string describing the type of the given value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/upcase.name: upcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/upcase.abstract: Returns the input string converted to uppercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/within.name: within
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/within.abstract: Returns true if the evaluated feature is fully contained inside a boundary of the input geometry, false otherwise. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type Polygon, MultiPolygon, Feature, or FeatureCollection. Supported features for evaluation:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/zoom.name: zoom
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/zoom.abstract: Returns the current zoom level. Note that in style layout and paint properties, [“zoom”] may only appear as the input to a top-level “step” or “interpolate” expression.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/linear.name: linear
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/linear.abstract: Interpolates linearly between the pair of stops just less than and just greater than the input

Structs/Expression.html#/init(operator:a.name: init(operator:arguments:)
Structs/Expression.html#/init(operator:a.abstract: Initialize an expression with an operator and arguments

Structs/Expression/Element.html.name: Element
Structs/Expression/Element.html.abstract: An ExpressionElement can be either a op (associated with a String)

Structs/Expression/Argument.html.name: Argument
Structs/Expression/Argument.html.abstract: An ExpressionArgument is either a literal (associated with a double, string, boolean, or null value)

Structs/Expression.html.name: Expression
Structs/Expression.html.abstract: An Expression defines a formula for computing the value of any layout property, paint property,

Expressions.html#/Exp.name: Exp
Expressions.html#/Exp.abstract: An Expression defines a formula for computing the value of any layout property, paint property,

Enums/TextWritingMode.html#/horizontal.name: horizontal
Enums/TextWritingMode.html#/horizontal.abstract: If a text’s language supports horizontal writing mode, symbols would be laid out horizontally.

Enums/TextWritingMode.html#/vertical.name: vertical
Enums/TextWritingMode.html#/vertical.abstract: If a text’s language supports vertical writing mode, symbols would be laid out vertically.

Enums/TextTranslateAnchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/TextTranslateAnchor.html#/map.abstract: The text is translated relative to the map.

Enums/TextTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/TextTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.abstract: The text is translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/TextTransform.html#/uppercase.name: uppercase
Enums/TextTransform.html#/uppercase.abstract: Forces all letters to be displayed in uppercase.

Enums/TextTransform.html#/lowercase.name: lowercase
Enums/TextTransform.html#/lowercase.abstract: Forces all letters to be displayed in lowercase.

Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/map.name: map
Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/map.abstract: When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_POINT}, aligns text east-west. When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE} or {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE_CENTER}, aligns text x-axes with the line.

Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/viewpo.name: viewport
Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/viewpo.abstract: Produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT}.

Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/auto.name: auto
Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html#/auto.abstract: When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_POINT}, this is equivalent to {@link Property#TEXT_ROTATION_ALIGNMENT_VIEWPORT}. When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE} or {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE_CENTER}, this is equivalent to {@link Property#TEXT_ROTATION_ALIGNMENT_MAP}.

Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html#/map.name: map
Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html#/map.abstract: The text is aligned to the plane of the map.

Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html#/viewport.abstract: The text is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

Enums/TextJustify.html#/auto.name: auto
Enums/TextJustify.html#/auto.abstract: The text is aligned towards the anchor position.

Enums/TextJustify.html#/left.name: left
Enums/TextJustify.html#/left.abstract: The text is aligned to the left.

Enums/TextJustify.html#/right.name: right
Enums/TextJustify.html#/right.abstract: The text is aligned to the right.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/center.name: center
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/center.abstract: The center of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/left.name: left
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/left.abstract: The left side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/right.name: right
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/right.abstract: The right side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/top.name: top
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/top.abstract: The top of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottom.name: bottom
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottom.abstract: The bottom of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/topLeft.name: topLeft
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/topLeft.abstract: The top left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/topRight.name: topRight
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/topRight.abstract: The top right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottomLeft.name: bottomLeft
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottomLeft.abstract: The bottom left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottomRight.name: bottomRight
Enums/TextAnchor.html#/bottomRight.abstract: The bottom right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/auto.name: auto
Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/auto.abstract: Sorts symbols by symbol sort key if set. Otherwise, sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if {@link ICON_ALLOW_OVERLAP} or {@link TEXT_ALLOW_OVERLAP} is set to {@link TRUE} or {@link ICON_IGNORE_PLACEMENT} or {@link TEXT_IGNORE_PLACEMENT} is {@link FALSE}.

Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/viewportY.name: viewportY
Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/viewportY.abstract: Sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if {@link ICON_ALLOW_OVERLAP} or {@link TEXT_ALLOW_OVERLAP} is set to {@link TRUE} or {@link ICON_IGNORE_PLACEMENT} or {@link TEXT_IGNORE_PLACEMENT} is {@link FALSE}.

Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/source.name: source
Enums/SymbolZOrder.html#/source.abstract: Sorts symbols by symbol sort key if set. Otherwise, no sorting is applied; symbols are rendered in the same order as the source data.

Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/point.name: point
Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/point.abstract: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located.

Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/line.name: line
Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/line.abstract: The label is placed along the line of the geometry. Can only be used on LineString and Polygon geometries.

Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/lineCenter.name: lineCenter
Enums/SymbolPlacement.html#/lineCenter.abstract: The label is placed at the center of the line of the geometry. Can only be used on LineString and Polygon geometries. Note that a single feature in a vector tile may contain multiple line geometries.

Structs/StyleTransition.html#/duration.name: duration
Structs/StyleTransition.html#/duration.abstract: Time allotted for transitions to complete in seconds.

Structs/StyleTransition.html#/delay.name: delay
Structs/StyleTransition.html#/delay.abstract: Length of time before a transition begins in seconds.

Structs/StyleColor.html#/red.name: red
Structs/StyleColor.html#/red.abstract: A value from 0 to 255, as required by the Mapbox Style Spec

Structs/StyleColor.html#/green.name: green
Structs/StyleColor.html#/green.abstract: A value from 0 to 255, as required by the Mapbox Style Spec

Structs/StyleColor.html#/blue.name: blue
Structs/StyleColor.html#/blue.abstract: A value from 0 to 255, as required by the Mapbox Style Spec

Structs/StyleColor.html#/alpha.name: alpha
Structs/StyleColor.html#/alpha.abstract: A value from 0 to 1, as required by the Mapbox Style Spec

Structs/StyleColor.html#/init(red:green:.name: init(red:green:blue:alpha:)
Structs/StyleColor.html#/init(red:green:.abstract: Creates a StyleColor from individually-provided color components. Returns nil

Structs/StyleColor.html#/init(from:).name: init(from:)
Structs/StyleColor.html#/init(from:).abstract: StyleColor can be decoded from an rgba expression or from an rgba color string

Structs/StyleColor.html#/encode(to:).name: encode(to:)
Structs/StyleColor.html#/encode(to:).abstract: StyleColor is always encoded to an rgba color string

Enums/SkyType.html#/gradient.name: gradient
Enums/SkyType.html#/gradient.abstract: Renders the sky with a gradient that can be configured with {@link SKY_GRADIENT_RADIUS} and {@link SKY_GRADIENT}.

Enums/SkyType.html#/atmosphere.name: atmosphere
Enums/SkyType.html#/atmosphere.abstract: Renders the sky with a simulated atmospheric scattering algorithm, the sun direction can be attached to the light position or explicitly set through {@link SKY_ATMOSPHERE_SUN}.

Enums/ResolvedImage.html#/name(_:).name: name(_:)
Enums/ResolvedImage.html#/name(_:).abstract: Use to assign a new resolved image with a name

Enums/ResolvedImage.html#/data(_:).name: data(_:)
Enums/ResolvedImage.html#/data(_:).abstract: A decode layer contains information in the form of ResolvedImageData.

Enums/RasterResampling.html#/linear.name: linear
Enums/RasterResampling.html#/linear.abstract: (Bi)linear filtering interpolates pixel values using the weighted average of the four closest original source pixels creating a smooth but blurry look when overscaled

Enums/RasterResampling.html#/nearest.name: nearest
Enums/RasterResampling.html#/nearest.abstract: Nearest neighbor filtering interpolates pixel values using the nearest original source pixel creating a sharp but pixelated look when overscaled

Enums/LineTranslateAnchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/LineTranslateAnchor.html#/map.abstract: The line is translated relative to the map.

Enums/LineTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/LineTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.abstract: The line is translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/LineJoin.html#/bevel.name: bevel
Enums/LineJoin.html#/bevel.abstract: A join with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line’s width.

Enums/LineJoin.html#/round.name: round
Enums/LineJoin.html#/round.abstract: A join with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line’s width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

Enums/LineJoin.html#/miter.name: miter
Enums/LineJoin.html#/miter.abstract: A join with a sharp, angled corner which is drawn with the outer sides beyond the endpoint of the path until they meet.

Enums/LineCap.html#/butt.name: butt
Enums/LineCap.html#/butt.abstract: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn to the exact endpoint of the line.

Enums/LineCap.html#/round.name: round
Enums/LineCap.html#/round.abstract: A cap with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line’s width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

Enums/LineCap.html#/square.name: square
Enums/LineCap.html#/square.abstract: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line’s width.

Enums/IconTranslateAnchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/IconTranslateAnchor.html#/map.abstract: Icons are translated relative to the map.

Enums/IconTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/IconTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.abstract: Icons are translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/IconTextFit.html#/none.name: none
Enums/IconTextFit.html#/none.abstract: The icon is displayed at its intrinsic aspect ratio.

Enums/IconTextFit.html#/width.name: width
Enums/IconTextFit.html#/width.abstract: The icon is scaled in the x-dimension to fit the width of the text.

Enums/IconTextFit.html#/height.name: height
Enums/IconTextFit.html#/height.abstract: The icon is scaled in the y-dimension to fit the height of the text.

Enums/IconTextFit.html#/both.name: both
Enums/IconTextFit.html#/both.abstract: The icon is scaled in both x- and y-dimensions.

Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/map.name: map
Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/map.abstract: When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_POINT}, aligns icons east-west. When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE} or {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE_CENTER}, aligns icon x-axes with the line.

Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/viewpo.name: viewport
Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/viewpo.abstract: Produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT}.

Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/auto.name: auto
Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html#/auto.abstract: When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_POINT}, this is equivalent to {@link Property#ICON_ROTATION_ALIGNMENT_VIEWPORT}. When {@link SYMBOL_PLACEMENT} is set to {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE} or {@link Property#SYMBOL_PLACEMENT_LINE_CENTER}, this is equivalent to {@link Property#ICON_ROTATION_ALIGNMENT_MAP}.

Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html#/map.name: map
Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html#/map.abstract: The icon is aligned to the plane of the map.

Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html#/viewport.abstract: The icon is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/center.name: center
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/center.abstract: The center of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/left.name: left
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/left.abstract: The left side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/right.name: right
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/right.abstract: The right side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/top.name: top
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/top.abstract: The top of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottom.name: bottom
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottom.abstract: The bottom of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/topLeft.name: topLeft
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/topLeft.abstract: The top left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/topRight.name: topRight
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/topRight.abstract: The top right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottomLeft.name: bottomLeft
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottomLeft.abstract: The bottom left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottomRight.name: bottomRight
Enums/IconAnchor.html#/bottomRight.abstract: The bottom right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html#/.name: map
Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html#/.abstract: The hillshade illumination is relative to the north direction.

Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html#/.name: viewport
Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html#/.abstract: The hillshade illumination is relative to the top of the viewport.

Enums/FillTranslateAnchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/FillTranslateAnchor.html#/map.abstract: The fill is translated relative to the map.

Enums/FillTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/FillTranslateAnchor.html#/viewport.abstract: The fill is translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/FillExtrusionTranslateAnchor.html#.name: map
Enums/FillExtrusionTranslateAnchor.html#.abstract: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the map.

Enums/FillExtrusionTranslateAnchor.html#.name: viewport
Enums/FillExtrusionTranslateAnchor.html#.abstract: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/CircleTranslateAnchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/CircleTranslateAnchor.html#/map.abstract: The circle is translated relative to the map.

Enums/CircleTranslateAnchor.html#/viewpo.name: viewport
Enums/CircleTranslateAnchor.html#/viewpo.abstract: The circle is translated relative to the viewport.

Enums/CirclePitchScale.html#/map.name: map
Enums/CirclePitchScale.html#/map.abstract: Circles are scaled according to their apparent distance to the camera.

Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html#/map.name: map
Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html#/map.abstract: The circle is aligned to the plane of the map.

Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html#/viewpor.name: viewport
Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html#/viewpor.abstract: The circle is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

Enums/Anchor.html#/map.name: map
Enums/Anchor.html#/map.abstract: The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the map.

Enums/Anchor.html#/viewport.name: viewport
Enums/Anchor.html#/viewport.abstract: The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the viewport.

Enums/Anchor.html.name: Anchor
Enums/Anchor.html.abstract: Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.

Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html.name: CirclePitchAlignment
Enums/CirclePitchAlignment.html.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Enums/CirclePitchScale.html.name: CirclePitchScale
Enums/CirclePitchScale.html.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html.name: HillshadeIlluminationAnchor
Enums/HillshadeIlluminationAnchor.html.abstract: Direction of light source when map is rotated.

Enums/IconAnchor.html.name: IconAnchor
Enums/IconAnchor.html.abstract: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html.name: IconPitchAlignment
Enums/IconPitchAlignment.html.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html.name: IconRotationAlignment
Enums/IconRotationAlignment.html.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Enums/IconTextFit.html.name: IconTextFit
Enums/IconTextFit.html.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Enums/RasterResampling.html.name: RasterResampling
Enums/RasterResampling.html.abstract: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter

Structs/StyleColor.html.name: StyleColor
Structs/StyleColor.html.abstract: Represents a color as defined by the Mapbox Style Spec

Enums/SymbolZOrder.html.name: SymbolZOrder
Enums/SymbolZOrder.html.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Enums/TextAnchor.html.name: TextAnchor
Enums/TextAnchor.html.abstract: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html.name: TextPitchAlignment
Enums/TextPitchAlignment.html.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html.name: TextRotationAlignment
Enums/TextRotationAlignment.html.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Enums/TextTransform.html.name: TextTransform
Enums/TextTransform.html.abstract: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS text-transform property.

Enums/TextWritingMode.html.name: TextWritingMode
Enums/TextWritingMode.html.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconAllowOverl.name: iconAllowOverlap
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconAllowOverl.abstract: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconAnchor.name: iconAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconAnchor.abstract: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconIgnorePlac.name: iconIgnorePlacement
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconIgnorePlac.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconImage.name: iconImage
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconImage.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconKeepUprigh.name: iconKeepUpright
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconKeepUprigh.abstract: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOffset.name: iconOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOffset.abstract: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of icon-size to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with icon-rotate the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOptional.name: iconOptional
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOptional.abstract: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconPadding.name: iconPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconPadding.abstract: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconPitchAlign.name: iconPitchAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconPitchAlign.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconRotationAl.name: iconRotationAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconRotationAl.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconSize.name: iconSize
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconSize.abstract: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by icon-size. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTextFit.name: iconTextFit
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTextFit.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTextFitPad.name: iconTextFitPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTextFitPad.abstract: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by icon-text-fit, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolAvoidEdg.name: symbolAvoidEdges
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolAvoidEdg.abstract: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolSortKey.name: symbolSortKey
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolSortKey.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is false, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is set to true, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolZOrder.name: symbolZOrder
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/symbolZOrder.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textAllowOverl.name: textAllowOverlap
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textAllowOverl.abstract: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textAnchor.name: textAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textAnchor.abstract: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textField.name: textField
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textField.abstract: Value to use for a text label. If a plain string is provided, it will be treated as a formatted with default/inherited formatting options. SDF images are not supported in formatted text and will be ignored.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textFont.name: textFont
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textFont.abstract: Font stack to use for displaying text.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textIgnorePlac.name: textIgnorePlacement
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textIgnorePlac.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textKeepUprigh.name: textKeepUpright
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textKeepUprigh.abstract: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textMaxWidth.name: textMaxWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textMaxWidth.abstract: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOffset.name: textOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOffset.abstract: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOptional.name: textOptional
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOptional.abstract: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textPadding.name: textPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textPadding.abstract: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textPitchAlign.name: textPitchAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textPitchAlign.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textRadialOffs.name: textRadialOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textRadialOffs.abstract: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol’s anchor. Useful in combination with text-variable-anchor, which defaults to using the two-dimensional text-offset if present.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textRotationAl.name: textRotationAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textRotationAl.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textTransform.name: textTransform
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textTransform.abstract: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS text-transform property.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textVariableAn.name: textVariableAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textVariableAn.abstract: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of text-anchor locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use text-justify: auto to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the text-radial-offset or the two-dimensional text-offset.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textWritingMod.name: textWritingMode
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textWritingMod.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconColor.name: iconColor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconColor.abstract: The color of the icon. This can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloBlur.name: iconHaloBlur
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloBlur.abstract: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloColor.name: iconHaloColor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloColor.abstract: The color of the icon’s halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloWidth.name: iconHaloWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconHaloWidth.abstract: Distance of halo to the icon outline.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOpacity.name: iconOpacity
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconOpacity.abstract: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTranslate.name: iconTranslate
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/iconTranslate.abstract: Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textColor.name: textColor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textColor.abstract: The color with which the text will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloBlur.name: textHaloBlur
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloBlur.abstract: The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloColor.name: textHaloColor
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloColor.abstract: The color of the text’s halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloWidth.name: textHaloWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textHaloWidth.abstract: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is ¼ of the font-size.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOpacity.name: textOpacity
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textOpacity.abstract: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textTranslate.name: textTranslate
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/textTranslate.abstract: Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereColo.name: skyAtmosphereColor
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereColo.abstract: A color used to tweak the main atmospheric scattering coefficients. Using white applies the default coefficients giving the natural blue color to the atmosphere. This color affects how heavily the corresponding wavelength is represented during scattering. The alpha channel describes the density of the atmosphere, with 1 maximum density and 0 no density.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereHalo.name: skyAtmosphereHaloColor
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereHalo.abstract: A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereSun.name: skyAtmosphereSun
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereSun.abstract: Position of the sun center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the sun relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the sun, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon. When this property is ommitted, the sun center is directly inherited from the light position.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereSunI.name: skyAtmosphereSunIntensity
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyAtmosphereSunI.abstract: Intensity of the sun as a light source in the atmosphere (on a scale from 0 to a 100). Setting higher values will brighten up the sky.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradient.name: skyGradient
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradient.abstract: Defines a radial color gradient with which to color the sky. The color values can be interpolated with an expression using sky-radial-progress.
