The range [0, 1] for the interpolant covers a radial distance (in degrees) of [0, sky-gradient-radius] centered at the position specified by sky-gradient-center.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradientCenter.name: skyGradientCenter
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradientCenter.abstract: Position of the gradient center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the gradient center relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the gradient center, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradientRadius.name: skyGradientRadius
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyGradientRadius.abstract: The angular distance (measured in degrees) from sky-gradient-center up to which the gradient extends. A value of 180 causes the gradient to wrap around to the opposite direction from sky-gradient-center.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyOpacity.name: skyOpacity
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/skyOpacity.abstract: The opacity of the entire sky layer.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterBrightne.name: rasterBrightnessMax
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterBrightne.abstract: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterBrightne.name: rasterBrightnessMin
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterBrightne.abstract: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterContrast.name: rasterContrast
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterContrast.abstract: Increase or reduce the contrast of the image.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterFadeDura.name: rasterFadeDuration
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterFadeDura.abstract: Fade duration when a new tile is added.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterOpacity.name: rasterOpacity
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterOpacity.abstract: The opacity at which the image will be drawn.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterResampli.name: rasterResampling
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterResampli.abstract: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterSaturati.name: rasterSaturation
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/rasterSaturati.abstract: Increase or reduce the saturation of the image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/bea.name: bearingImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/bea.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the middle of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/sha.name: shadowImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/sha.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the background of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/top.name: topImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/top.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the top of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.name: accuracyRadius
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.abstract: The accuracy, in meters, of the position source used to retrieve the position of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.name: accuracyRadiusBorderColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.abstract: The color for drawing the accuracy radius border. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.name: accuracyRadiusColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/acc.abstract: The color for drawing the accuracy radius, as a circle. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/bea.name: bearingImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/bea.abstract: The size of the bearing image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/emp.name: emphasisCircleColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/emp.abstract: The color of the circle emphasizing the indicator. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/emp.name: emphasisCircleRadius
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/emp.abstract: The radius, in pixel, of the circle emphasizing the indicator, drawn between the accuracy radius and the indicator shadow.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/ima.name: imagePitchDisplacement
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/ima.abstract: The displacement off the center of the top image and the shadow image when the pitch of the map is greater than 0. This helps producing a three-dimensional appearence.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/loc.name: location
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/loc.abstract: An array of [latitude, longitude, altitude] position of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/loc.name: locationIndicatorOpacity
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/loc.abstract: The opacity of the entire location indicator layer.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/per.name: perspectiveCompensation
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/per.abstract: The amount of the perspective compensation, between 0 and 1. A value of 1 produces a location indicator of constant width across the screen. A value of 0 makes it scale naturally according to the viewing projection.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/sha.name: shadowImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/sha.abstract: The size of the shadow image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/top.name: topImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/top.abstract: The size of the top image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineMiterLimit.name: lineMiterLimit
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineMiterLimit.abstract: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineRoundLimit.name: lineRoundLimit
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineRoundLimit.abstract: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineSortKey.name: lineSortKey
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineSortKey.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineBlur.name: lineBlur
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineBlur.abstract: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineColor.name: lineColor
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineColor.abstract: The color with which the line will be drawn.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineDasharray.name: lineDasharray
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineDasharray.abstract: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with lineMetrics: true specified won’t render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineGapWidth.name: lineGapWidth
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineGapWidth.abstract: Draws a line casing outside of a line’s actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineGradient.name: lineGradient
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineGradient.abstract: Defines a gradient with which to color a line feature. Can only be used with GeoJSON sources that specify "lineMetrics": true.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineOffset.name: lineOffset
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineOffset.abstract: The line’s offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineOpacity.name: lineOpacity
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineOpacity.abstract: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/linePattern.name: linePattern
Structs/LineLayer.html#/linePattern.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineTranslate.name: lineTranslate
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineTranslate.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineTrimOffset.name: lineTrimOffset
Structs/LineLayer.html#/lineTrimOffset.abstract: The line part between [trim-start, trim-end] will be marked as transparent to make a route vanishing effect. The line trim-off offset is based on the whole line range [0.0, 1.0].

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeAc.name: hillshadeAccentColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeAc.abstract: The shading color used to accentuate rugged terrain like sharp cliffs and gorges.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeHi.name: hillshadeHighlightColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeHi.abstract: The shading color of areas that faces towards the light source.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeIl.name: hillshadeIlluminationAnchor
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeIl.abstract: Direction of light source when map is rotated.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeIl.name: hillshadeIlluminationDirection
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeIl.abstract: The direction of the light source used to generate the hillshading with 0 as the top of the viewport if hillshade-illumination-anchor is set to viewport and due north if hillshade-illumination-anchor is set to map.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeSh.name: hillshadeShadowColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/hillshadeSh.abstract: The shading color of areas that face away from the light source.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapColor.name: heatmapColor
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapColor.abstract: Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap. Should be an expression that uses ["heatmap-density"] as input.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapIntens.name: heatmapIntensity
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapIntens.abstract: Similar to heatmap-weight but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapOpacit.name: heatmapOpacity
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapOpacit.abstract: The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapRadius.name: heatmapRadius
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapRadius.abstract: Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed. queryRenderedFeatures on heatmap layers will return points within this radius.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapWeight.name: heatmapWeight
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/heatmapWeight.abstract: A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillSortKey.name: fillSortKey
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillSortKey.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillAntialias.name: fillAntialias
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillAntialias.abstract: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillColor.name: fillColor
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillColor.abstract: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as rgba with an alpha component and the color’s opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillOpacity.name: fillOpacity
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillOpacity.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the fill-color, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillOutlineColor.name: fillOutlineColor
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillOutlineColor.abstract: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of fill-color if unspecified.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillPattern.name: fillPattern
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillPattern.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillTranslate.name: fillTranslate
Structs/FillLayer.html#/fillTranslate.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionIntensity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: Controls the intensity of shading near ground and concave angles between walls. Default value 0.0 disables ambient occlusion and values around 0.3 provide the most plausible results for buildings.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: Shades area near ground and concave angles between walls where the radius defines only vertical impact. Default value 3.0 corresponds to height of one floor and brings the most plausible results for buildings.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionBase
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to fill-extrusion-height.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionColor
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion’s surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root light settings. If this color is specified as rgba with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use fill-extrusion-opacity to set layer opacity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionHeight
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: The height with which to extrude this layer.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a per-layer, not per-feature, basis, and data-driven styling is not available.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionPattern
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/fillExt.abstract: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fill-extrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleSortKey.name: circleSortKey
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleSortKey.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleBlur.name: circleBlur
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleBlur.abstract: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleOpacity.name: circleOpacity
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleOpacity.abstract: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circlePitchAli.name: circlePitchAlignment
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circlePitchAli.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circlePitchSca.name: circlePitchScale
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circlePitchSca.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleStrokeWi.name: circleStrokeWidth
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleStrokeWi.abstract: The width of the circle’s stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the circle-radius.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleTranslat.name: circleTranslate
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/circleTranslat.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.name: backgroundColor
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.abstract: The color with which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.name: backgroundOpacity
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.abstract: The opacity at which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.name: backgroundPattern
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/background.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Enums/LayerType.html#/fill.name: fill
Enums/LayerType.html#/fill.abstract: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

Enums/LayerType.html#/raster.name: raster
Enums/LayerType.html#/raster.abstract: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

Enums/LayerType.html#/hillshade.name: hillshade
Enums/LayerType.html#/hillshade.abstract: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data.

Enums/LayerType.html#/background.name: background
Enums/LayerType.html#/background.abstract: The background color or pattern of the map.

Protocols/Layer.html#/filter.name: filter
Protocols/Layer.html#/filter.abstract: A expression specifying conditions on source features.

Protocols/Layer.html#/source.name: source
Protocols/Layer.html#/source.abstract: Name of a source description to be used for this layer.

Protocols/Layer.html#/sourceLayer.name: sourceLayer
Protocols/Layer.html#/sourceLayer.abstract: Layer to use from a vector tile source.

Protocols/Layer.html#/minZoom.name: minZoom
Protocols/Layer.html#/minZoom.abstract: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Protocols/Layer.html#/maxZoom.name: maxZoom
Protocols/Layer.html#/maxZoom.abstract: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Protocols/Layer.html#/init(jsonObject:).name: init(jsonObject:)
Protocols/Layer.html#/init(jsonObject:).abstract: Initializes a Layer given a JSON dictionary

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html.name: BackgroundLayer
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html.abstract: The background color or pattern of the map.

Structs/FillLayer.html.name: FillLayer
Structs/FillLayer.html.abstract: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html.name: HillshadeLayer
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html.abstract: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.

Structs/RasterLayer.html.name: RasterLayer
Structs/RasterLayer.html.abstract: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

Structs/SkyLayer.html.name: SkyLayer
Structs/SkyLayer.html.abstract: A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.

Enums/Encoding.html#/terrarium.name: terrarium
Enums/Encoding.html#/terrarium.abstract: Terrarium format PNG tiles. See https://aws.amazon.com/es/public-datasets/terrain/ for more info.

Enums/Encoding.html#/mapbox.name: mapbox
Enums/Encoding.html#/mapbox.abstract: Mapbox Terrain RGB tiles. See https://www.mapbox.com/help/access-elevation-data/#mapbox-terrain-rgb for more info.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/url.name: url
Structs/VectorSource.html#/url.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/tiles.name: tiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/tiles.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/bounds.name: bounds
Structs/VectorSource.html#/bounds.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/scheme.name: scheme
Structs/VectorSource.html#/scheme.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/minzoom.name: minzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/minzoom.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/maxzoom.name: maxzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/maxzoom.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/attribution.name: attribution
Structs/VectorSource.html#/attribution.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/promoteId.name: promoteId
Structs/VectorSource.html#/promoteId.abstract: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form {<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}. If specified as a string for a vector tile source, the same property is used across all its source layers. If specified as an object only specified source layers will have id overriden, others will fallback to original feature id

Structs/VectorSource.html#/volatile.name: volatile
Structs/VectorSource.html#/volatile.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/prefetchZoomD.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/VectorSource.html#/prefetchZoomD.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/minimumTileUp.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/VectorSource.html#/minimumTileUp.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/maxOverscaleF.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/maxOverscaleF.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/tileRequestsD.name: tileRequestsDelay
Structs/VectorSource.html#/tileRequestsD.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/tileNetworkRe.name: tileNetworkRequestsDelay
Structs/VectorSource.html#/tileNetworkRe.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/url.name: url
Structs/RasterSource.html#/url.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/tiles.name: tiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/tiles.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/bounds.name: bounds
Structs/RasterSource.html#/bounds.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/minzoom.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/minzoom.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/maxzoom.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/maxzoom.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/tileSize.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterSource.html#/tileSize.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/scheme.name: scheme
Structs/RasterSource.html#/scheme.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/attribution.name: attribution
Structs/RasterSource.html#/attribution.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/volatile.name: volatile
Structs/RasterSource.html#/volatile.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/prefetchZoomD.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/RasterSource.html#/prefetchZoomD.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/minimumTileUp.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/RasterSource.html#/minimumTileUp.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/maxOverscaleF.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/maxOverscaleF.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.

The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/data.name: data
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/data.abstract: A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/maxzoom.name: maxzoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/maxzoom.abstract: Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/attribution.name: attribution
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/attribution.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/buffer.name: buffer
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/buffer.abstract: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/tolerance.name: tolerance
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/tolerance.abstract: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/cluster.name: cluster
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/cluster.abstract: If the data is a collection of point features, setting this to true clusters the points by radius into groups. Cluster groups become new Point features in the source with additional properties:

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterRadiu.name: clusterRadius
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterRadiu.abstract: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterMaxZo.name: clusterMaxZoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterMaxZo.abstract: Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered). Clusters are re-evaluated at integer zoom levels so setting clusterMaxZoom to 14 means the clusters will be displayed until z15.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterPrope.name: clusterProperties
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/clusterPrope.abstract: An object defining custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points. Has the form {"property_name": [operator, map_expression]}. operator is any expression function that accepts at least 2 operands (e.g. "+" or "max") — it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains; map_expression produces the value of a single point.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/lineMetrics.name: lineMetrics
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/lineMetrics.abstract: Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify line-gradient values.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/generateId.name: generateId
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/generateId.abstract: Whether to generate ids for the geojson features. When enabled, the feature.id property will be auto assigned based on its index in the features array, over-writing any previous values.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/promoteId.name: promoteId
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/promoteId.abstract: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form {<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/prefetchZoom.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/prefetchZoom.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/Light.html#/intensity.name: intensity
Structs/Light.html#/intensity.abstract: Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.

Structs/Light.html#/position.name: position
Structs/Light.html#/position.abstract: Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in [r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where r indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, a indicates the position of the light relative to 0 degree (0 degree when light.anchor is set to viewport corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0 degree when light.anchor is set to map corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and p indicates the height of the light (from 0 degree, directly above, to 180 degree, directly below).

Extensions/TransitionOptions.html#/durat.name: duration
